br.span: Stay in touch with Abilene USD 435 by downloading our new mobile app!

p.span: Download on your mobile device today and select yes to receive push notifications with the latest news and updates from the Dist
rict. To learn more, click here.

div.p:
______________________________________________________
Weekly Announcements
Principals from Kennedy, McKinley, and Eisenhower have posted videos to share this week's announcements! To view your school's announcements, please visit the school's page by clicking the buttons below!
______________________________________________________

strong.span: Art, Music, and P.E. Class Pages are now available!

span.span: On Thursday, April 9th, from 1:00pm-3:00pm, PowerSchool may be
inaccessible due to maintenance work. We are

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; color: rgb(29, 184, 14);

span.span: As your family navigates these challenging times, we want you to know that we are still here to support your child and family’s well-being.

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(29, 184, 14);
p.span: Click HERE for information from our district's counselors.

br.span: Visit the Tech Tools page for help!

p.style: margin-bottom: 0px; text-align: left; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); -webkit-text-stroke-width: initial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

a.title: auth
a.span: What You Need to Know About Your Elementary Student Bringing Their iPad Home

br.span: Read more about connecting to WiFi, care and cleaning, problem solving, and tech support.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(227, 108, 9);

br.span: Due to the current circumstances, Driver's Ed, which was to be hosted by USD 435, has been postponed until further notice.

span.style: caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); letter-spacing: 0.30000001192092896px; text-align: center; font-family: latobold; color: rgb(227, 108, 9);

p.span: The administration and staff of USD 435 are working hard to provide a positive learning experience for all students amidst this transition. Below are the goals that the district have named as their top priority during the implementation of the Continuous Learning program.

br.span:
1) Support the overall physical health and emotional wellbeing of students, staff, and community.
2) Ensure that all seniors on track to graduate can maintain that progress.
3) Ensure that all students are ready to start school next fall (No lost credits, essential learning for success in the 2020-2021 school year).
Click HERE to read the
Kansas Family Guide to Continuous Learning
